review: This is a great buy for friends / family who are not tech savvy: it's very easy to use via voice (if you have the phone app), and the interface is pretty streamlined as well.I had previously bought my parents an Apple TV, thinking it would be easy for them to navigate...but they ended up "gifting" it back to me (lol), as they just couldn't figure it out & use it without frustration. This surprised me, to be quite honest, as I figured the Apple interface would be very user-intuitive. I think the ultra-thin and 'minimalist' apple Remote design might have actually played a part in this.The Fire TV Stick's remote, however, is a bit beefier and feels more substantial...not to mention doesn't get lost as easy!Unfortunately this unit's remote doesn't have the voice-commands of its big-brother built into the remote (separate purchase), but you can't really expect that for the price you pay. It also doesn't have surround sound output like the regular Fire TV -- but again, for the price you pay, this unit really does deliver its worth.
author: The Active Geek
